title: Neighbours star Jackie Woodburne reveals surprising friendship with Natalie Bassingthwaighte
text:
They're the beloved Neighbours characters who are celebrating 25 years as an on-screen couple.

And as Jackie Woodburne and Alan Fletcher discussed their marriage milestone on The Project, they revealed something quite surprising about Izzy Hoyland actress Natalie Bassingthwaighte.

The much-loved actors - who play Ramsay Street residents Carl and Susan Kennedy - admitted people were 'shocked' to learn they're the best of pals with Nat, whose character almost split up their on-screen marriage.

25 years in the making! Alan Fletcher and Jackie Woodburne discussed their marriage milestone on The Project on Friday night

Jackie, 63, admitted: 'When we were doing promotion and filming in London, Nat and I would be out often... and people would be shocked!'

She added: 'I love Nat Bass. She is terrific.'

Alan, 62, agreed: 'We're all fabulous pals!'

They're all friends! Natalie Bassingthwaighte (right) played villain Izzy Hoyland on the soap, who had an affair with Dr Karl Kennedy

Nat's character famously had a rocky relationship with Dr Karl, after she seduced him to make him leave his wife Susan.

After initially faking that she was expecting his child, Izzy later fell pregnant after slipping Karl some sleeping syrup and pretending she was Susan - and infamously gave birth during the pair's wedding ceremony.

Karl had to deliver the child at his own wedding in London - and bizarrely enough, his understanding wife Susan ended up becoming Godmother to his and Izzy's baby daughter, Holly.

She broke hearts! Nat's character Izzy famously had a rocky relationship with Dr Karl, after she craftily seduced him to make him leave his wife

'It's been quite symbiotic like that,' Alan added.

'I'm pleased to have my beautiful stage wife in Jackie and my real life wife, Jennifer, of 30 years.

'Nat is a great pal.I have three very brilliant talented special women.'
description: They're the beloved Neighbours characters who are celebrating 25 years as an on-screen couple.
authors: Nicole Douglas For Daily Mail Australia
